intro: Hieracium engleri, commonly known as the Engler's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium engleri is often found in open habitats and is relatively low-growing, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
